content.description: Green Right is a little easier with a rating of 5.8 if you take the crack to the left, and 5.7 if you do the lie back crack on the right.
Green Left includes a crux near the top at the overhang with a 5.9 level of difficulty if you take a direct line up. Varying from the direct line can increase the difficulty to 5.10.
content.location: Climbers far left in the Green area. Anchors closest to the wooden lookout platform

content.description: This one can be climbed a few different ways, and crack start was my favorite. If you follow the crack and keep going to the right, it will be a little easier to complete with large foot holds. If you stay left it is a little more challenging but it ends with some good shelves
content.protection:
3 Bolts are at the top of this route, 2 together, and then one 15 or so feet away (this is the one shown in the picture).  

  Bring extra webbing for the 2 bolts that are together, you can set the route off the ledge, but there is another overhang that you will rub on if the webbing is too short
content.location: Park at the Wingo lot and hike to the trail head and turn left. The Green route is the first one you will come to

content.description: The Green area has two anchor points, and climbs range in difficulty from 5.7- 5.9 depending on where you setup your rope.Â
